public final class PieceTable extends AbstractTextBuffer
Piece table implementation.
More info at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piece_table

  • Constructor Details

    • PieceTable

      public PieceTable(Document document)
      Creates a piece table using the original text of a document, and sets the original unit buffer, that will contain one or more units. A document contains 0, 1 or more decorations. If there is no decoration present, for each unit a piece is defined, that spans over the length of the unit. If there are decorations, for each one, units are defined, pieces are defined, that spans over its length
      Parameters:
      document - model with decorated text to start with

  • Method Details

    • getText

      public String getText()
      Returns full text. This is a costly operation as it walks through all the pieces
      Returns:
      full text

    • getText

      public String getText(int start, int end)
      Returns partial text
      Parameters:
      start - start position within text, inclusive
      end - end position within text, exclusive
      Returns:
      partial text
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if start or end are not in index range of the text

    • getInternalPosition

      public int getInternalPosition(int position)
      Converts a position or index referred to the exportable text into the position of internal text
      Parameters:
      position - the index from exportable text
      Returns:
      an index from internal text

    • getInternalSelection

      public Selection getInternalSelection(Selection selection)
      Converts the indices of a selection of exportable text into the indices of a selection of internal text
      Parameters:
      selection - a selection with indices from exportable text
      Returns:
      a selection with indices from internal text

    • walkFragments

      public void walkFragments(BiConsumer<Unit,Decoration> onFragment, int start, int end)
      Walks through unit fragments. Each fragment is represented by related text and decoration
      Parameters:
      onFragment - callback to get fragment info
      start - the initial position of the fragment
      end - the end position of the fragment (not included)
